text:
East 151st Street, north side, west from Cedar Lane to Walton Ave. The G.W. Bromley map of 1923, as revised to September 1932 shows the site to be occupied by a large 7-story apartment house, bearing No. 175.

May 16, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.

Grand Concourse (vantage point, not seen), west side, between East 151st and 153rd Streets, showing a view, in a northwesterly direction, of the New York Central Railroad tracks. Also shown are: Walton Ave. crossing the tracks over the bridge, the Bronx Municipal Terminal market (left background), and the Yankee Stadium (right).

May 16, 1928.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Bronx: Grand Concourse - 151st Street (East)
